channel.title: KFC Double Down Sandwich
channel.description:
Anyone ever tried one? I had been putting it off because they were $5.99 which was ridiculous, the other day I went ahead and got one for $4.99 though, despite the hefty price tag. It was pretty delectable I suppose, but I probably wouldn't buy another one because it's too damn expensive and not worth it.
If you don't know what this is, it is basically a 'sandwich' composed of 2 fried chicken filets (instead of a bun) around two slices of bacon and two slices of cheese: http://www.kfc.com/doubledown/ Definitely not the most healthy sandwich in the world, but good to try once I suppose. :)
Any other crazy foods you have seen/heard/tried?

Cockroaches are good anyways, who cares. The chili is too good (and cheap) to quit eating over just that. Especially when you pour like half a bottle of hot sauce in it and some shredded cheese and crushed up crackers.

item.title: KFC Double Down Sandwich
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:94, topic:365573”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=461777.msg3397799#msg3397799 date=1289624271]
What about Wendy’s 1/4 lb Single burger? I’ve eaten it once and it tastes really good (because an outlet just opened near me). The beef chilli is also kind of delicious.

Burger: http://www.wendys.com/food/Family.jsp?family=1
Beef chilli: http://www.wendys.com/food/Family.jsp?family=7
[/quote]

Wendy’s beef chili is pretty good, but I no longer eat it after my dad found a roach in the bottom of his bowl a few years ago. :|[/quote]
That’s gross, but I’m pretty much not worried about the Wendy’s outlet here. It’s recently opened and is very clean. I feel like eating there again, despite the long queue.

Read full topic

item.title: KFC Double Down Sandwich
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:83, topic:365573”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=461777.msg3384929#msg3384929 date=1288380971]
I went to KFC today and got one, it was fucking delicious.
[/quote]

A Double Down or poutine? I’d like to try this poutine stuff, I’ll probably go hunting in Canada one day and grab some.

[table]
[tr][td]Name[/td] [td]Calories[/td] [td]Fat(g)[/td] [td]Sodium(mg)[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]KFC Original Recipe® Double Down[/td] [td]540[/td] [td]32[/td] [td]1380[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]KFC Grilled Double Down[/td] [td]460[/td] [td]23[/td] [td]1430[/td][/tr]
[/table]

Holy shit

Doesn’t really seem that bad. A McDonald’s Big Mac has 540 calories, 29 grams of fat, and 1040 of sodium, so a double down isn’t any worse. It’s not like anyone orders these things thinking they are health foods.[/quote]

I never liked big macs. But that’s because in Canada we have The Double Big Mac. Still takes 2 to fill me. 700 calories each

Read full topic

item.title: KFC Double Down Sandwich
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:83, topic:365573”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=461777.msg3384929#msg3384929 date=1288380971]
I went to KFC today and got one, it was fucking delicious.
[/quote]
A Double Down or poutine? I’d like to try this poutine stuff, I’ll probably go hunting in Canada one day and grab some. :)[/quote]
Double Down, it was pretty greasy, but I found it went down a lot better than a Wendy’s Baconator.

The KFC poutine is also excellent, I don’t know why anyone would find it disgusting…people put gravy on mashed potatoes all the time, and well, you can put cheese on absolutely anything, so why the hell not.

Read full topic
